modmenu.descriptionTranslation.onebar: HUD mod that shows the values and bars only when you need them.
text.autoconfig.onebar.title: OneBar configuration
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.showOneBar: Disabling will show vanilla HUD instead
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.healthEsti: Toggles the texts and bars for (natural) regeneration, hunger effect, poison etc.
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.uhcMode.@T: Disables natural regen estimates, if effect estimates are enabled
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.disableHun:
Hides the hunger bar/text, hunger effect and
starvation estimates etc, meant for certain minigames
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.background: §8Every color is preceded by the opacity value in hex, see mod page for help
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.enableGrad:
Makes all bars' colors gradually shift from base color to darker or lighter
Known bug: gradient is not applied to horse jump bar
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.gradientSh:
Percentage of color change
0 - darkest
100 - no gradient
200 - lightest
The gradient is harder to notice with dark base colors, such as black.
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.textSettin: Show numbers and symbols on OneBar
Disabling will still show numeric absorption health and hardcore indicator (if exist)
E.g. health-related effect estimates will be grouped; if effect estimates are enabled

For example, when you are burning, you'll see:
🔥1× with this option enabled
bu1× with this option disabled
Disabling is recommended when your font doesn't support the emoji.
Shows emoji or abbreviations for health, hunger and absorption as well

If vanilla-like fractions are enabled: adds zeroes to even numbers.
This is beneficial if the numbers change a lot as it will reduce flickering.
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.goodThings: Show resistance effect level as percentage, e.g. level 2 shows 40% (level × 20%)

Shows the amount of Totem of Undyings in your inventory;
crossed out when not held in main/offhand.
Food level restoration by held food
Shows an overlay on hunger bar when holding any food item and player has hunger
Food level restoration color: exact or less
Meaning zero saturation - various activities will increase the hunger

1× - burning
2× - in fire
3× - in soul fire
4× - in lava

Shows the levitation effect time as a bar and indicator,
crossed out while in water

Tells you the amount of blocks you're about to fall in-air,
while having levitation effect or while crouching on an edge.
Currently does not consider target block type, your effects and enchants.
Shows an indicator when you have glowing effect from a spectral arrow
Levels over one mean extra waves and chances of enchanted weapons

The closest (100 blocks) warden's anger level towards the player or other causes.
20-11 - angry, chasing
10-6 - agitated
5-0 - calm, can despawn
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.entity.sho:
Horse: vertical bar below crosshair
camel: horizontal bar below crosshair

Shows approximate horse jump height in blocks,
camels are not yet supported

Shows a decreasing cooldown bar that indicates when
the camel can jump or move again

Negative seconds before
the camel can jump or move again
text.autoconfig.onebar.option.armor.show: Thin bar above OneBar; also for ridden horses
Overlay on armor bar, width adapts to armor bar or armor bar segment

Shows armor bar in four separate segments, to allow seeing
the armor/durability value for each individual piece.
Note: customized armor values (e.g. a chestplate that gives 20 armor)
will not be reflected - vanilla bug.

Normal armor bar: displayed as a full-width overlay only when flying;
segmented armor bar: displayed constantly as a diamond-width bar at chest segment.
Hides the experience level and/or bar when the value is zero
A counter next to XP level that counts Lapis Lazuli items/blocks in your inventory
Lapis Lazuli counter: show times enchantable maxed out
Instead of raw value, shows how many times can you do max enchants with XP level 30+
Dynamically moves the hotbar selected item tooltip further down
Allows some other mods to show their HUD elements around OneBar
